translated: They are helpful in that they assist them in taking up the precepts, either equally or even more than themselves. analyzed: zhe 'gras pa yang rnam pa gnyis te / nyes par spyad pa spyod pa de dag ni gnod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kyi sdug bsngal dang 'brel pa'i 'gro ba mngon sum du bstan pas mi dge ba las skyob par byed pa dang / legs par spyad pa spyod pa de dag ni rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis 'dun par byed pa la sogs pas dga' ba chung ngu dang /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul @196b khrims rnam pa gsum la gnas pa'i tshul khrims rnam pa gsum yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba'i rgyu bstan par 'dod pa'i phyir /

translated: Just as one who has the idea of grass as something to be avoided does not look at grass, and one who has the idea of excrement as something to be avoided does not look at excrement, in the same way, the bodhisattva does not look at the grass-like desires,

analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung bas ji ltar 'dod pa tha chad spangs pa rnams la mi lta ba de bas ni /

analyzed: dper na 'jigs pa chen po sna tshogs kyis gang zhig gzing gzing bar 'jug pa ni gnod pa'i rtsa ba yin te /

analyzed: de bas na gcig pu zhes bya ba smos so //

original: tshogs kyi nang na 'dus kyang sems dben par 'gyur te tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin gyi de nyid la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / dbang thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed do //
analyzed: tshogs kyi nang na 'dus kyang sems dben par 'gyur te tshul khrims tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin gyi de nyid la brten nas byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa mngon par sgrub pa dang / dbang thob par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par byed do //
translated: Even when he is in the midst of the assembly, his mind is secluded. He does not consider mere morality to be sufficient, but rather, on that basis, he strives to accomplish the immeasurable meditative concentrations of the bodhisattva and to attain mastery over them.

analyzed: ngan pa'i gtam zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gtam mo //
translated: Bad speech means afflicted speech.

analyzed: ngan pa'i tshig ces bya ba ni de nyid rnam grangs kyi sgo nas bstan pa'o // dang du len par mi byed ces bya ba ni mi smra ba ste /
translated: Bad words means just that, taught by way of synonym.ğŸ”½He does not tolerate means he does not speak.

original: mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

translated: The phrase â€œa mind that does not actâ€ means a mind that does not intend to act.

original: sems gang gis skyes pa de 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems gang gis skyes pa de 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: He would desire the mind that has arisen.

translated: If he becomes accustomed to desire, he would not indulge in it, but would delight in remaining incompatible with indulgence.

analyzed: skrag pa ni 'jigs pa'o //

original: zhum pa ni bag tsha ba'o //
analyzed: zhum pa ni bag tsha ba'o //

analyzed: 'gong ba ni bdag gis mi nus kyang srid do snyam pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: spro ba kho na bskyed pa'i phyir de dag kyang mir gyur pa yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: gzhan gnod pa byed pa la sems mi 'khrug pa dang / gzhan gyis gnod pa byas pa la phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba med pas na bzod pa bstan to //

analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyi ma 'ongs pa'i nyes pa la de ltar nan tan byed pas ni phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i nyes pa mi brjed pa'i phyir na dbus kyi mtha' dang ldan pa'o //

analyzed: de ltar so sor rtog pa na de kho na bzhin du rtog pa la 'jug pa'i phyir na rjes su spyod pa'o // cho ga phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas /

original: dge ba mi spyoms zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: dge ba mi spyoms zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //

analyzed: 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas tshul 'chos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: With regard to the excellence of livelihood, he mentions â€œhypocrisyâ€ and so on.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug mngon par sgrub pa la ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug mngon par sgrub pa la ni /
translated: In the practice of the six perfections,

analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The counteragents to the perfection of wisdom are fivefold.

analyzed: de ltar na de dag gi gnyen por gyur pa rnam pa bcu sa de la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba dpag tu med pa myur du sdud par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the ten kinds of counteragents to these are the ten virtues of the bodhisattva who is established in this stage, which quickly gather together his immeasurable merit.

original: lus dang longs spyod la lhag par zhen na lus dang longs spyod la lta bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod la lhag par zhen na lus dang longs spyod la lta bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is attached to body and possessions, one has a view of body and possessions.

original: lta ba yod na yongs su mi gtong ngo //
analyzed: lta ba yod na yongs su mi gtong ngo //

original: de lta bas na de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin te /

translated: The perfection of morality is due to not accepting the basis of immorality.ğŸ”½The perfection of patience is due to not producing a hostile mind toward sentient beings.

original: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems kyi sems mi skyed pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //ğŸ”½gnyid @198a * //
analyzed: sems can rnams la kun nas mnar sems kyi sems mi skyed pas ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //ğŸ”½gnyid @198a * //
translated: The perfection of vigor is due to not being lazy about the good.ğŸ”½The perfection of concentration is due to not being distracted.ğŸ”½The perfection of wisdom is due to not being confused about the teachings.ğŸ”½The perfection of skill in regard to means is due to not abandoning samsara.ğŸ”½The perfection of vows is due to not being discouraged.ğŸ”½The perfection of power is due to not being overcome by opposition.ğŸ”½The perfection of knowledge is due to not being confused about the knowledge of all things.

original: la sogs pa'i bde ba'i dbang du byas te le lo mi bsten pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: la sogs pa'i bde ba'i dbang du byas te le lo mi bsten pa ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is the non-indulgence in laziness, in the sense of taking up the favorable.

analyzed: bsam gtan gyis la nyon mongs pa mi skyed pas ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the non-production of afflictions by means of meditation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal ba'i shes rab rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni 'chal ba'i shes rab rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The five kinds of bad judgment are the resistances to the perfection of wisdom:

original: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i phan yon rab tu mi shes pa dang / dge ba'i rgyu rab tu mi shes pa dang / 'bras bu la phyin ci log tu kun du spyod pa dang / phyin ci log gi gnyen po rab tu mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i phan yon rab tu mi shes pa dang / dge ba'i rgyu rab tu mi shes pa dang / 'bras bu la phyin ci log tu kun du spyod pa dang / phyin ci log gi gnyen po rab tu mi shes pa dang /
translated: not knowing the benefit of the result of merit; not knowing the cause of virtue; misapprehending the result; not knowing the antidote to misapprehension;

translated: As it is said, The teaching of the Dharma by skillful means is the teaching of the Dharma by the TathÄgatas for the sake of abandoning the faults of sentient beings.ğŸ”½ As it is said

original: bstan pa la ma zhugs pa rnams ni dad pa thob par bya ba'i sgo nas 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: bstan pa la ma zhugs pa rnams ni dad pa thob par bya ba'i sgo nas 'jug par byed do //

analyzed: zhugs pa rnams ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i sgo nas ngan song las yang dag par 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir yang dag phul gyi chos ston to //
translated: Those who have entered it are taught the supreme doctrine in order to cause them to transcend evil destinies by abandoning the mental afflictions that are to be abandoned by means of vision.

original: lam thob pa rnams la ni kun du sbyor ba lhag ma spong ba'i sgo nas yang srid pa'i sdug bsngal las 'da' bar byag phyir thabs mkhas pas ston to //
analyzed: lam thob pa rnams la ni kun du sbyor ba lhag ma spong ba'i sgo nas yang srid pa'i sdug bsngal las 'da' bar byag phyir thabs mkhas pas ston to //
translated: Those who have attained the path are taught skillfully in order to cause them to transcend the suffering of renewed existence by abandoning the remaining fetters.

original: phan 'dogs pa la lan du phan gdags par 'dod pa rnams la ni yang dag par dga'/
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa la lan du phan gdags par 'dod pa rnams la ni yang dag par dga'/

analyzed: bar byed pa sngon du gtong ba'i rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i lan du phan 'dogs pa mnyam pa'am lhag pas nye bar gnas pas don byed do //
translated: Those who are established in the benefit that they have received repay the benefit that they have received by means of an equal or greater benefit.

original: de dag nyid kyi bya ba la grogs med pa de dag nyid 'di la ni grogs byed du 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi bya ba la grogs med pa de dag nyid 'di la ni grogs byed du 'gro bar byed do //

analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams la ni sdug bsngal rab tu zhi bar byed do //

original: 'jigs pa rnams la ni 'jigs pa las skyob par byed do //
analyzed: 'jigs pa rnams la ni 'jigs pa las skyob par byed do //

analyzed: sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnams la ni mya ngan bsang bar byed do //

original: yo byad med pa rnams la ni nye bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: yo byad med pa rnams la ni nye bar sgrub par byed do //

translated: He or she is a friend who inspires those who are hostile toward the teaching to take an interest in it.

translated: The king is the lord of the country who has the power to punish and to reward. The thieves are those who steal wealth by force or stealth. The enemies are those who create obstacles to one's enjoyment, etc. The other lords are those who have obtained sovereignty over immeasurable things.

original: gang gi byad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / legs par spyod pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mi snyan pa'i 'jigs pa dang smra ba'i bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'khor du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi byad dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'tsho ba med pa'i 'jigs pa dang / legs par spyod pa dang mi ldan pa'i phyir mi snyan pa'i 'jigs pa dang smra ba'i bya ba dang mi ldan pa'i phyir 'khor du bag tsha ba'i 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The fear of not being able to make a living is due to the lack of beauty. The fear of disrepute is due to the lack of good conduct. The fear of embarrassment in the assembly is due to the lack of eloquence.

original: mi ma yin pa las gyur pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi ma yin pa las gyur pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: gnyen bshes kyi sdug bsngal ba dang / longs spyod kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen bshes kyi sdug bsngal ba dang / longs spyod kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Suffering is also of two kinds: 1. that which is due to the suffering of friends and relatives, and 2. that which is due to the suffering of possessions.

original: de la gnas skabs kyi log par brjod pa'i rgyu'i rtog pa ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: de la gnas skabs kyi log par brjod pa'i rgyu'i rtog pa ni mya ngan no //

translated: There are five kinds of friends and relatives, because of the connection with the place of birth and the necessity of association.

original: sems can thams cad kyi ris mthun pa'i mi rtag par bstan pas de sel bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi ris mthun pa'i mi rtag par bstan pas de sel bar byed do //
translated: Grief due to their death is dispelled by the teaching of impermanence in regard to all sentient beings.

analyzed: de las skyes pa'i mya ngan la yang pha ma shi ba las gyur pa dang / bu dang chung @200b ma shi ba las gyur pa rnams ni che ba'o //
translated: The grief that arises from that is also great, whether it is from the death of a parent or from the death of a child or spouse.

analyzed: bran la sogs pa la ni /
translated: For servants, etc.,

original: dgos shing gces pa'i sgo nas ci rigs par rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgos shing gces pa'i sgo nas ci rigs par rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: the three types are appropriate in accordance with their need and value.

original: rdzas rnams la yang yo byad bsgrub par bya ba'i tshul khrims sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: rdzas rnams la yang yo byad bsgrub par bya ba'i tshul khrims sngon du btang ste /
translated: With regard to material things, the morality of providing necessities is taught first.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por bstan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa bzhi'i gnyen por bstan pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The teaching of the antidote to the four kinds of suffering is similar.

original: yongs su sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang zang zing sgrub pas bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su sdud pa'i tshul khrims ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa dang zang zing sgrub pas bstan to //
translated: The morality of attraction is taught by the perfection of aspiration and by the provision of material things.

original: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni zang zing med pa'i gtong bas bstan to //
analyzed: bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni zang zing med pa'i gtong bas bstan to //
translated: The perfection of aspiration is taught by the giving of the non-material.

original: zang zing gi longs spyod ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: zang zing gi longs spyod ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The enjoyment of material things is of two kinds:

original: gzhan las bslang ba dang / thun mongs du longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las bslang ba dang / thun mongs du longs spyod pa'o //
translated: that which is obtained from others and that which is enjoyed in common.

original: sems dang mthun pa'i tshul khrims ni /
analyzed: sems dang mthun pa'i tshul khrims ni /
translated: The morality of mental harmony is taught by the perfection of vigor.

original: bstan pa dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bstan pa dang rgyas pa'i sgo nas rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood in terms of teaching and development.

original: bstan pa ni sems can rnams kyi mos pa dang / khams kyi dbang gis de lta de lta bur sgrub par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa ni sems can rnams kyi mos pa dang / khams kyi dbang gis de lta de lta bur sgrub par bstan pa ste /
translated: Teaching is the teaching of practice in accordance with the various dispositions and aspirations of sentient beings.

original: gzhung las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhung las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: It is as stated in the scriptures.

original: de la bsam pa ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam pa ni sems pa'o //
translated: Here, intention is thought.

original: rang bzhin ni mos pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni mos pa'o //
translated: Nature is aspiration.

original: khams ni bag la nyal ba'o //
analyzed: khams ni bag la nyal ba'o //
translated: Disposition is latency.

original: lus dang ngag gi sbyor ba gang gis gzhan dag gis sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi sbyor ba gang gis gzhan dag gis sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: By whatever bodily and verbal actions the suffering and displeasure of others would arise,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba skye yang gal te de dag la phan pa dang bde bar mi 'gyur na ni byang chub sems dpa' so sor brtags te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba skye yang gal te de dag la phan pa dang bde bar mi 'gyur na ni byang chub sems dpa' so sor brtags te /
translated: and even if suffering and displeasure would arise, if they would not be beneficial and pleasant for them, the bodhisattva, having examined,

original: bdag nyid dang gzhan dag la yang phan pa med pa'i phyir 'jug par mi byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang gzhan dag la yang phan pa med pa'i phyir 'jug par mi byed do //
translated: does not engage in them, because they are not beneficial for oneself or others.

original: gal te phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba zhig yin ni mthun par 'jug par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: gal te phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba zhig yin ni mthun par 'jug par yang mi byed de /
translated: If they would be beneficial and pleasant, he does not engage in them in a way that is agreeable to others.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i tshe de dag nyid la bde ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i tshe de dag nyid la bde ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are happy when they change.

original: snying brtse ba'i sems kyis ni byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems kyis ni byed pa nyid do //
translated: With a compassionate mind, he acts.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi sbyor ba la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi sbyor ba la yang /
translated: Similarly, with regard to the practice of others,

original: gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid la mthun par 'jug par yang mi byed la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid la mthun par 'jug par yang mi byed la /
translated: he does not act in accordance with the characteristics that have been taught in order to conform with the minds of others.

original: mthun par 'jug par yang byed de /
analyzed: mthun par 'jug par yang byed de /
translated: He does act in accordance with them.

original: mdor bsdu na bdag nyid dang gzhan la ltos te rjes su 'jug go //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bdag nyid dang gzhan la ltos te rjes su 'jug go //
translated: In brief, he acts in accordance with himself and others.

original: bdag nyid kyi lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas bcas pa'i bslab pa'i gzhir gtogs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas bcas pa'i bslab pa'i gzhir gtogs pa yang ma yin /
translated: He does not give up his own physical and verbal conduct that is included in the bases of training established by the TathÄgata,

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin na ni gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'i phyir te gtong bar byed do //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin na ni gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba'i phyir te gtong bar byed do //
translated: and he does not give up the essence of the accumulations of merit and knowledge, even for the sake of protecting the minds of others.

original: de las bzlog pa ni gtong bar mi byed do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni gtong bar mi byed do //
translated: He does not give up the opposite of these.

original: bdag la ltos pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bdag la ltos pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: He acts in accordance with himself in the same way.
How does he give up his own physical and verbal conduct in dependence on the thoughts of others?

original: ltar de pha rol gyi bsam pa la ltos nas lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa gtong zhing gzhan dag gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba'i sgo nas phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir 'jug cing mi gtong la /
analyzed: ltar de pha rol gyi bsam pa la ltos nas lus dang ngag gi kun du spyod pa gtong zhing gzhan dag gi bde ba dang sdug bsngal skye ba'i sgo nas phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir 'jug cing mi gtong la /

analyzed: mgon yod pa nyid kyi phyir na nus pa'o //

original: yang na bdag nyid kyis nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid kyis nus pa'i phyir ro //

original: nad rgyun rings ni yun ring du na ba la yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nad rgyun rings ni yun ring du na ba la yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: mi shes zhes bya ba ni tshul ston mi shes pa'o //

translated: or if the student is of a wild nature, difficult to train because of lack of faith and respect, then there is no fault if the teacher does not teach, even though he is capable of doing so.

original: yang dag par slong ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i slod ba po ste /
analyzed: yang dag par slong ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i slod ba po ste /

original: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa la sogs pa bsdus so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa la sogs pa bsdus so //

original: 'khor bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su bzung la bdag nyid grags shing bsod nams che ba'i phyir gos la sogs pa rnyed pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni yongs su bzung la bdag nyid grags shing bsod nams che ba'i phyir gos la sogs pa rnyed pa'am /

original: yang na bdag nyid tshol nus kyang rung ste ma byin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid tshol nus kyang rung ste ma byin pa'o //

original: bcos su mi rung ba'i skabs nyid ni bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //

analyzed: pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i @216a * //

analyzed: sems can gyi don du gtogs pa'i phyir byas na yang nyes byas su ni mi 'gyur gyi /

original: cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhe na /

original: legs par byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs par byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //

original: de bas na 'dod chags las 'byung ba ni nyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags las 'byung ba ni nyes pa ma yin no //

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la sdang ba ni bdag dang gzhan la phan par spyod pa ma yin te /

analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa byed pa ni nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: And to do what is not the task is a misdeed.

translated: Therefore, in the case of the basis of the misdeed that arises from hatred, the thought of ill will usually occurs.

analyzed: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas nyan thos rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyams pa bzhi bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /

analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang / lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality, the perfection of view, the perfection of conduct, and the perfection of livelihood.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' @216b rnams kyi gtan gyi sdom pa yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' @216b rnams kyi gtan gyi sdom pa yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims nyams pa med do //
translated: The bodhisattvas have no deficiency in morality because it is their eternal vow.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa gzhan du phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir /ğŸ”½rang gi 'dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa gzhan du phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir / rang gi 'dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the other three perfections, he says:ğŸ”½The perfection of morality is to be known as the purity of the three types of acts.ğŸ”½The perfection of morality is to be known as the purity of the three types of acts: bodily, verbal, and mental.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa la brten pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa la brten pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o /
translated: The first perfection is based on the purification of bodily, verbal, and mental conduct.

original: yang dag par rab tu byung ba'i bsgrub pa'i bsam pas legs par brjod pa'i gnas pa la brten pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu byung ba'i bsgrub pa'i bsam pas legs par brjod pa'i gnas pa la brten pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second is based on the state of being well-spoken, with the intention of accomplishing the true going forth.

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams kyis phongs pa med pa'i mchog la brten pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams kyis phongs pa med pa'i mchog la brten pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The third is based on the highest lack of want with regard to the requisites of livelihood.

original: 'dral bar mi byed pa ni bslab pa'i bzhi las 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dral bar mi byed pa ni bslab pa'i bzhi las 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He does not break them, because he does not violate the four basic rules of morality.

original: bslab par gtogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kun du spyod pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa yongs su dag go //
analyzed: bslab par gtogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kun du spyod pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa yongs su dag go //
translated: He is pure in his bodily conduct, etc., because he practices the bodily, vocal, and mental actions that are in conformity with the training.

original: bslab pa dag la gus pa dang / bag yod par shas cher gnas pas na nyes pa rgyun du mi byed do //
analyzed: bslab pa dag la gus pa dang / bag yod par shas cher gnas pas na nyes pa rgyun du mi byed do //
translated: He does not habitually commit offenses, because he is respectful toward the rules of the training and is very much concerned with being heedful.

original: brgya la nyes pa zhig byas na yang mthol bas sdig pa 'a chags par byed de //
analyzed: brgya la nyes pa zhig byas na yang mthol bas sdig pa 'a chags par byed de //
translated: And even if he should happen to commit an offense, he confesses it and thus purifies it.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis thog ma dang bar dang tha ma rnams su sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis thog ma dang bar dang tha ma rnams su sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: These three aspects show the excellence of his application at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end.

original: yang dag par rab tu byang bar sbyor ba ni chos kyi bsam pas rab tu 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu byang bar sbyor ba ni chos kyi bsam pas rab tu 'byung ba yin no //
translated: His application to purification is his going forth with the thought of Dharma.

original: nyan thos rnams ni bdag 'dul bar bya ba la sogs pa'i don rab tu byung ba'i phyir legs par rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni bdag 'dul bar bya ba la sogs pa'i don rab tu byung ba'i phyir legs par rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: The disciples are said to have gone forth well, because they have gone forth for the sake of disciplining themselves, etc.

original: / byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du rab tu byung ba'i phyir legs par rab tu byung ba yin te /
analyzed: / byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du rab tu byung ba'i phyir legs par rab tu byung ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is well gone forth, because he has gone forth for the sake of ripening his own qualities of a Buddha.

original: de'i phyir byang chub chen po don du gnyer ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub chen po don du gnyer ba zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he is called one who seeks great enlightenment.

original: don du mi gnyer ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni de gcig pur nges par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni de gcig pur nges par bstan pa ste /
translated: He is not one who does not seek, i.e. he is one who is definitely intent on that.

original: de'i don kho nar rab tu byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i don kho nar rab tu byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He has gone forth for that very purpose.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i sbyor ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i sbyor ba'i 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: He is one who seeks the way of an ascetic, i.e. the result of the application of his practice is shown.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge sbyong gi tshul ni sa bcu po dag la bslab pa gsum gyi sbyor bar gtogs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge sbyong gi tshul ni sa bcu po dag la bslab pa gsum gyi sbyor bar gtogs pa'i lam mo //
translated: The way of an ascetic for a bodhisattva is the path which is included in the application of the three trainings on the ten spiritual levels.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni theg pa chen po'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni theg pa chen po'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Nirvana is the parinirvana of the universal vehicle.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as the nirvana which is not a state of stagnation.

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bstan to //ğŸ”½kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'i phyir bsam pa phun sum tshogs @217a * //
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bstan to // kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'i phyir bsam pa phun sum tshogs @217a * //
translated: Thus, by the power of the intention to enter, the perfection of intention is taught as being without defilement.ğŸ”½The perfection of intention is taught as being without laziness, etc.

original: pa ni le lo med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: pa ni le lo med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: because of the absence of defilement.

original: le lo med pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnams la brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le lo med pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnams la brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Without laziness means that one is energetic in the wholesome.

original: ma 'dres pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams bar chad pa yod pa dang / bar chad med pa kun du mi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams bar chad pa yod pa dang / bar chad med pa kun du mi spyod pa ste /
translated: Undefiled means that one does not practice the defiled and undefiled dharmas with obstacles and without obstacles.

original: de la sdig pa ni smad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sdig pa ni smad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, defiled means that one is despised.

original: mi dge ba rnams ni dge ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni dge ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Undefiled means that one is not opposed to the wholesome.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni tshe 'di nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir zhing 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni tshe 'di nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir zhing 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Defiled means that one is defiled in this very life and that one is not established in the wholesome.

original: yang 'byung bas ni tshe phyi ma la yang 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'byung bas ni tshe phyi ma la yang 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is a source of suffering because it produces suffering in the future.

original: rims nad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rims nad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Fever is a defilement.

original: rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: And it is a source of suffering because it produces suffering in the future.

original: de'i nyes dmigs ni tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas lus dang sems yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gro 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang 'byung ba rnams so; ;
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs ni tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas lus dang sems yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gro 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir yang 'byung ba rnams so; ;
translated: The disadvantage of that is that in this life, because of the practice of defilement, there is the burning of body and mind, and in the future life, the establishment of the miserable states of existence.

original: // de bas na phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shir 'gyur ba de ni nyes dmigs yin te /
analyzed: // de bas na phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shir 'gyur ba de ni nyes dmigs yin te /
translated: Therefore, birth and old age and death in the future are a disadvantage,

original: yun ring por skye ba dang rga shi 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring por skye ba dang rga shi 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they lead to birth and old age and death for a long time.

original: bsod nams byas pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po kun du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams byas pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po kun du bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meritorious is taught in order to show the meritorious deeds that arise from giving.

original: dge ba byas pas ni longs spyod chen po'i bar du gcod pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba byas pas ni longs spyod chen po'i bar du gcod pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and by performing virtue, one abandons the obstacles to great enjoyment.

original: gzhan yang bsod nams ni bsod nams kyi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsod nams ni bsod nams kyi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, merit is for the sake of the purpose of merit;

original: dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: virtue is for the sake of the purpose of non-remorse.

original: phongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phongs par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni mi ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: One does not become destitute means one does not lack.

original: de dag thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means one obtains them.

original: phun sum tshogs pa dang po nyin mtshan du dga' zhing mchog tu dga' ba'i shas che ba'i phyir bde ba la reg par gnas so //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa dang po nyin mtshan du dga' zhing mchog tu dga' ba'i shas che ba'i phyir bde ba la reg par gnas so //
translated: One abides in contact with pleasure in the first, because one has a great deal of joy and delight day and night.

original: gnyis pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa'i phyir yang bde ba la reg par gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa'i phyir yang bde ba la reg par gnas so //
translated: One abides in contact with pleasure in the second, because one abides without affliction.

original: gsum pa ste phongs pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir yang bde ba la reg par gnas so //
analyzed: gsum pa ste phongs pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir yang bde ba la reg par gnas so //
translated: One abides in contact with pleasure in the third, because one abandons destitution.

original: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa zhes bya ba la mdo ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa zhes bya ba la mdo ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The two types of sutra are the concise and the extensive.

original: khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is included in the category of the householder and the category of the renunciate.

original: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is also threefold:

original: sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang dge ba sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang dge ba sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of accepting vows, the morality of gathering virtue, and the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: rgyas par ni ji skad bstan @217b pa'i rab tu dbye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par ni ji skad bstan @217b pa'i rab tu dbye ba bzhin no //
translated: It is extensive as explained in the analysis above.

original: de las gzhan pa 'di'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims thams cad nyid kyi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'di'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims thams cad nyid kyi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: The other divisions of morality are all moralities,

original: dka' ba'i tshul khrims nas rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bar ro //
analyzed: dka' ba'i tshul khrims nas rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bar ro //
translated: from the morality of difficulty to the morality of purity.

original: de ltar na bstan pas ni tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na bstan pas ni tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid bstan to //
translated: Thus, the nature of morality is taught by the teaching.

original: bshad pas ni tshul khrims thams cad bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pas ni tshul khrims thams cad bstan to //
translated: All morality is taught by the explanation.

original: bshad pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni dka' ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni dka' ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The morality of difficulty and so on are taught by the analysis of the explanation.

original: dka' ba'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dka' ba'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The morality of difficulty is established in three ways:

original: gtang dka' ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i tshul khrims len pas na yang dag par len pa dka' ba la brten to //
analyzed: gtang dka' ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i tshul khrims len pas na yang dag par len pa dka' ba la brten to //
translated: He is based on the morality of giving up what is difficult to give up, because he takes up the giving of all difficult things to give.

original: blangs na nyam thag par gyur kyang yongs su mi gtong bas na rjes su bsrung ba dka' ba la brten to //
analyzed: blangs na nyam thag par gyur kyang yongs su mi gtong bas na rjes su bsrung ba dka' ba la brten to //
translated: He is based on the difficulty of protecting, because he does not give up even when he is exhausted.

original: rgyu ba dang gnas pa dag la shin tu dran pa nye bar gnas pas na yongs su dag pa dka' pa la brten to //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang gnas pa dag la shin tu dran pa nye bar gnas pas na yongs su dag pa dka' pa la brten to //
translated: He is based on the difficulty of purification, because his mindfulness is well established in all his movements and postures.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du yang 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du yang 'chad de /
translated: Others explain these four in a different way.

original: len pa dang srung ba'i sgo nas dka' bar ston to //
analyzed: len pa dang srung ba'i sgo nas dka' bar ston to //
translated: They show the difficulty of taking up and protecting.

original: de la srung ba ni nyams la bab par gyur kyang shin tu yongs su skyong ba dang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la srung ba ni nyams la bab par gyur kyang shin tu yongs su skyong ba dang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Protecting is the thorough protection and thorough purification of the morality that has been taken up.

original: longs spyod chen po ni rnam pa bzhi dang lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: longs spyod chen po ni rnam pa bzhi dang lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: Great enjoyment is to be known through four or five aspects.

original: bzhi zhes bya ba ni gang gis longs spyod par bya ba'i lus kyis te /
analyzed: bzhi zhes bya ba ni gang gis longs spyod par bya ba'i lus kyis te /
translated: The four are the body by which one enjoys,

original: lus kyi 'byor par 'gyur bas na longs spyod che ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'byor par 'gyur bas na longs spyod che ba'o //
translated: He has great wealth because he has a wealthy body.

original: gang dag dang lhan cig pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag dang lhan cig pa ste /
translated: He has great friends because he has friends who are

original: gnyen 'dab dang rtsa lag sdug cing byams pa nas yid du 'ong ba'i bar dag dang ngo //
analyzed: gnyen 'dab dang rtsa lag sdug cing byams pa nas yid du 'ong ba'i bar dag dang ngo //
translated: dear, friendly, and pleasant.

original: de dag kyang mang ba dang che ba'i phyir na che ba'o //ğŸ”½gang dag gis bsgrub pa ni dran pa la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mang ba dang che ba'i phyir na che ba'o // gang dag gis bsgrub pa ni dran pa la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
translated: They are great because they are numerous and important.ğŸ”½He has great mindfulness because he has great mindfulness, etc.

original: de dag kyang mang ba dang / che ba'i phyir che ba'o //ğŸ”½gang longs spyod ni zas dang skom la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang mang ba dang / che ba'i phyir che ba'o // gang longs spyod ni zas dang skom la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are great because they are numerous and important.ğŸ”½He has great wealth because he has great wealth of food and drink, etc.

original: de ltar lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / phyogs chen po dang 'khor chen po dang / nor dang yo byad phal po cher gyur ba'i longs spyod che bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / phyogs chen po dang 'khor chen po dang / nor dang yo byad phal po cher gyur ba'i longs spyod che bar bstan to //
translated: Thus, he has a great body, great friends, and great wealth.

original: rnam pa lngas ji ltar zhe na lus gang gis ci'i phyir longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ji ltar zhe na lus gang gis ci'i phyir longs spyod pa ste /
translated: How is he great in five ways? He is great in body, in friends, in wealth, in mindfulness, and in courage.

original: 'tsho ba'i phyir yin la de gnyis kyang che ba'i phyir che ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i phyir yin la de gnyis kyang che ba'i phyir che ba'o //
translated: He has a great body because he is tall and strong.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba'i tshogs phal po che spang ba'i phyir dka' ba'o //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba'i tshogs phal po che spang ba'i phyir dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to give up a great accumulation of wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses.

original: nor dang 'bru mang bas na dbang phyug chen po'o //ğŸ”½dka' btsan pas de dag la ci dga' dgur @218a * //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru mang bas na dbang phyug chen po'o // dka' btsan pas de dag la ci dga' dgur @218a * //
translated: Because of the great wealth and grain, he is a great lord.ğŸ”½Because of the difficulty of giving them up, he is a great lord over the great lords,

original: dbang byed pa'i tshul gyis na dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: dbang byed pa'i tshul gyis na dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed pa ste /
translated: in the sense that he has power over them.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni gtang bar mi nus pa yin la /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni gtang bar mi nus pa yin la /
translated: These three things are impossible to give up.

original: de btang bas na tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dka' ba yin te /
analyzed: de btang bas na tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dka' ba yin te /
translated: But he gives them up, and that is the difficulty of taking up morality.

original: mdo gzhan las kyang 'di skad du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi'i dbang phyug la dbang byed par 'gyur ba de lta bu yang 'dod na /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las kyang 'di skad du 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi'i dbang phyug la dbang byed par 'gyur ba de lta bu yang 'dod na /
translated: In another sutra it is said, â€œIf he desires to be a universal monarch, a lord with power over the four continents,

original: skad cig gcig kho nas btsun mo dang longs spyod thams cad spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: skad cig gcig kho nas btsun mo dang longs spyod thams cad spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab tu 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: in a single instant he gives up his queens, his wealth, and all his enjoyments, and goes forth into the teaching of the Tathagata.â€

original: nyams la bab par gyur pa ni srog la thug kyang zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: nyams la bab par gyur pa ni srog la thug kyang zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is intent on the morality of restraint is one who does not commit a transgression even for the sake of his life.

original: 'chi ba la thug pa'i sdug bsngal gyis thebs na yang srog gi phyir yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'chi ba la thug pa'i sdug bsngal gyis thebs na yang srog gi phyir yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even when he is overcome by the suffering of death, he does not commit a transgression even for the sake of his life.

original: rgyu ba dang gnas pa dang yid la byed pa thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la sogs pa la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i bag yod par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang gnas pa dang yid la byed pa thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la sogs pa la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i bag yod par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In all his activities, whether he is walking, standing, sitting, or lying down, he is endowed with supreme mindfulness and vigilance, and he is heedful, abiding in the fivefold heedfulness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag pas na brgya lam na gnas skabs 'ga' tsam la yang dag par blangs pa'i skad cig phyin chad nas ma shi ba'i bar du yang nyes pa mi byed de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag pas na brgya lam na gnas skabs 'ga' tsam la yang dag par blangs pa'i skad cig phyin chad nas ma shi ba'i bar du yang nyes pa mi byed de /
translated: The bodhisattva, whose attitude and practice are pure, does not commit a transgression even for an instant after he has taken up the morality, until the end of time.

original: de ltar na rjes su bsrung ba'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su bsrung ba'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te dka' ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the morality of restraint is difficult for the bodhisattva because it is so well guarded.

original: rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad kyi sgo'o /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad kyi sgo'o /
translated: The morality of the four practices is the door of all.

original: // / sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis bsgrubs pas na yang dag par blang ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: // / sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis bsgrubs pas na yang dag par blang ba byas pa'o //
translated: It is taken up by the performance of the special application.

original: sems dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang / smon pa la mi lta bas na rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sems dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang / smon pa la mi lta bas na rang bzhin gyis tshul khrims so //
translated: It is natural morality, since it is not dependent on the mind, on the formation, or on the vow.

original: yun ring po dang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dus nas zhugs pas na goms pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po dang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dus nas zhugs pas na goms pa'o //
translated: It is habitual, since it is practiced for a long time and without interruption.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos pos yongs su zin pas na thabs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos pos yongs su zin pas na thabs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with means, since it is accompanied by the means of attraction.

original: rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa phul du phyin pa'i rtags kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi'o //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa phul du phyin pa'i rtags kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi'o //
translated: The stage of the one who is established in the lineage is the stage of the practice of the signs of the perfections of generosity, etc.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las te /
translated: It is irreproachable, since it is the action of body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu yin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu yin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'thob pa'o //
translated: And since it is the cause of the perfection of morality, it is called the perfection.

original: goms pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor bas gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma dang / gya nom pa bas kyang ches gya nom par tshul khrims la goms par gyur te /
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor bas gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma dang / gya nom pa bas kyang ches gya nom par tshul khrims la goms par gyur te /
translated: Through the distinctive practice of cultivation, he cultivates morality to an ever-greater degree, to an ever-higher degree, to an ever-subtler degree.

original: de bas na sngon gyi tshe @218b rabs gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na sngon gyi tshe @218b rabs gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, in other former lives, etc.

original: de'i phyir dper na rang bzhin gyis gtsang zhing khrus byas la lus byugs pa ni mi gtsang ba dang mi mthun zhing mi 'dod pa de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis sdig pa rnams la zhe sdang la de'i gnyen po dge ba rnams la dga' zhing dge ba 'dod
analyzed: de'i phyir dper na rang bzhin gyis gtsang zhing khrus byas la lus byugs pa ni mi gtsang ba dang mi mthun zhing mi 'dod pa de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis sdig pa rnams la zhe sdang la de'i gnyen po dge ba rnams la dga' zhing dge ba 'dod
translated: Therefore, just as one who is naturally clean, who has bathed and anointed his body, is averse to and does not desire what is unclean, so he is averse to evil by nature, and he delights in and desires the virtues which are the antidotes to that.

original: do // bslab pa la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las ni thabs dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: do // bslab pa la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las ni thabs dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims te /
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva who is diligent in the training, and who is engaged in generosity, etc., is morality endowed with means,

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is supported by the means of the four principles for attracting a following.

original: bdag dang gzhan la mi gnod par sgrub pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la mi gnod par sgrub pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa yin te /
translated: He is a holy man because he practices without harming himself or others.

original: sgrub pa de yang bdag nyid dang gzhan dag phan 'dogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro //ğŸ”½skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims rnam par gzhag pa ni bdag nyid kyang yang dag par len pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba'i yan lag phun sum tshogs pas thog ma dang tha mas skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims su 'gyur ba dang / gzhan ni tha mal ba dang zhe 'gras pa dang /
analyzed: sgrub pa de yang bdag nyid dang gzhan dag phan 'dogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro // skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims rnam par gzhag pa ni bdag nyid kyang yang dag par len pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba'i yan lag phun sum tshogs pas thog ma dang tha mas skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims su 'gyur ba dang / gzhan ni tha mal ba dang zhe 'gras pa dang /
translated: And that practice is the performance of bodily, verbal, and mental actions that benefit both himself and others.ğŸ”½The morality of the holy man is presented as the morality of the holy man at the beginning and at the end, because it is perfect in the aspects of taking up and maintaining.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa'i bye brag gis tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa'i bye brag gis tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The other three kinds of morality are considered in terms of the three kinds of morality, namely, the morality of the ordinary man, the morality of the hostile, and the morality of the one who is correctly engaged.

original: de la snga ma rnams ni yang dag par len du 'jug go //
analyzed: de la snga ma rnams ni yang dag par len du 'jug go //
translated: Among them, the first kind of morality induces the taking up of the other three kinds of morality.

original: zhe 'gras pa rnams la ni bsngags pa brjod do //
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa rnams la ni bsngags pa brjod do //
translated: The second kind of morality is praised for the hostile.

original: de dag gis bsngags pa dang phan yon thos na kun nas mnar sems kyi sems rtse zhil bar 'gyur du re ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bsngags pa dang phan yon thos na kun nas mnar sems kyi sems rtse zhil bar 'gyur du re ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they hope that their hostile thoughts will be pacified when they hear the praise and the benefits of the bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams mthong na ni yid dga' bar 'gyur la 'gran par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams mthong na ni yid dga' bar 'gyur la 'gran par yang mi byed de /
translated: But when they see those who are correctly practicing, they are pleased and do not compete with them.

original: de ltar na tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas gzhan dag la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas gzhan dag la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, in terms of morality, the bodhisattvasâ€™ morality is shown to be the morality of holy ones, which is endowed with the special activities of body, speech, and mind in relation to others.

original: rnam grangs gcig gis rnam pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: rnam grangs gcig gis rnam pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa drug go //
translated: It is sixfold because it is completed in six aspects by one enumeration.

original: rnam grangs cig shos kyis rnam pa bdun yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: rnam grangs cig shos kyis rnam pa bdun yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa bdun no //
translated: It is sevenfold because it is completed in seven aspects by another enumeration.

original: gnyi ga bsdoms pas rnam pa bcu gsum yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: gnyi ga bsdoms pas rnam pa bcu gsum yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
translated: It is thirteenfold because it is completed in thirteen aspects by combining the two enumerations.

original: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa ni 'bras bu dang phan yon che ba ste de bas na 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa'o //ğŸ”½rgya chen po la bslab @219a * //
analyzed: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa ni 'bras bu dang phan yon che ba ste de bas na 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa'o // rgya chen po la bslab @219a * //
translated: The dedication to great enlightenment is the great fruit and benefit. Therefore, it is perfect in its complete fruit.

original: pa'i gzhi rgyas par blang ba'i phyir gnas yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i gzhi rgyas par blang ba'i phyir gnas yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The basis of training in the vast is perfect in its basis, because it takes up the vast.

original: rgya che ba ni rgya chen du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni rgya chen du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The vast should be called the great.

original: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba dang bral ba yin te /
translated: It is free from the suffering of the afflicted, because it is free from the extreme of indulgence in pleasure.

original: de bas na kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is irreproachable.

original: bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir don med pa'i sdug bsngal rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir don med pa'i sdug bsngal rnam par spangs te /
translated: It is free from the suffering of the unbeneficial, because it is free from the extreme of self-mortification.

analyzed: de bas na rab tu dga' ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is the basis of the highest joy.

original: bar du gcod pa yongs su btang bas de ji srid 'tsho'i bar gyi bslab pa dang ldan pas na rgyun du chud pa'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa yongs su btang bas de ji srid 'tsho'i bar gyi bslab pa dang ldan pas na rgyun du chud pa'o //

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten te /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten te /

analyzed: de'i sgo nas nyams par mi byed pas de'i phyir zil gyis mi non pa'o //
translated: because it is not destroyed by them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bcas pa'i tshul khrims phul nas mu stegs can gyi gnas rnams su sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i phyir phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pas zil gyis non par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bcas pa'i tshul khrims phul nas mu stegs can gyi gnas rnams su sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i phyir phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pas zil gyis non par 'gyur te /
translated: It is not overcome by opponents, because it does not take up the vows of the tirthikas in the midst of the tirthikas, having abandoned the morality established by the Tathagata.

analyzed: de med pas na de dag gis zil gyis non par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not overcome by those because it does not exist in them.

original: dge slong sar pa sar pa rnams ni dge sbyong gi gnod pa rnams kyis gtses so zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa de lta bus bslab pa phul nas nyams shing ldog pa'i phyir dang / bslab pa 'dral bas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis non par 'gyur la //

translated: The sutras say that new monks are afflicted by the afflictions of ascetics, because they regress and violate the precepts due to such afflictions, and because they are overcome by secondary afflictions.

analyzed: rnam pa de rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir brtan pa'o // rgyan dang ldan pa yin pas na /

translated: The ornaments of ethical discipline are being endowed with faith, being unwavering, having few afflictions, being diligent, being wise, having few desires, and so on up to being endowed with ascetic qualities.
